sentences.text: Supreme Court Justice Story [photo, below] thus wrote (1833): "The right of the citizens to keep and bear arms has justly been considered the palladium of the liberties of a republic; since it offers a strong moral check against usurpation and arbitrary power of rulers; and will generally, even if these are successful in the rst instance, enable the people to resist and triumph over them."(1) These are strong words better said by the American Founding Fathers in explaining the reason for the Second Amendment than to be left unsaid to a posterity that may have forgotten why the natural right of gun ownership was written into the U.S. Constitution.

sentences.text: While in the landmark case Reid v. Covert (1957), the Supreme Court ruled that the U.S. Constitution supersedes the power of treaties, many left leaning, liberal scholars have tried to circumvent that ruling with creative arguments, claiming the treaty power vested in the Constitution supersedes other internal U.S. laws, even if these are duly enacted laws, and even if the treaty itself contravenes the U.S. Constitution.

sentences.text: For them, it is axiomatic that a creature is never greater than its creator! For years, so encouraged, several politicians and influential members of the Democratic Party have worked hand-in-glove with their political counterparts in the United Nations (UN) to pass several versions of the UN's Small Arms Treaty.

sentences.ctext: For them, it is axiomatic that a creature is never greater than its creator! For years, so encouraged, several politicians and influential members of the Democratic Party have worked hand-in-glove with their political counterparts in the United Nations (UN) to pass several versions of the UN's Small Arms Treaty.

sentences.text: A recent attempt, the Arms Trade Treaty (ATT), was tabled in July 2012; but according to Gun Owners of America (GOA), UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon called "the unraveling" of the ATT merely a setback, and experts at the UN expect further discussions and the taking of a vote at the next session of the UN when the General Assembly reconvenes.(2) Prior to the election, President Obama had temporarily halted his support for the UN Arms Trade Treaty because, according to several news sources, gun control efforts could have hurt his bid for re-election in November.

sentences.text: This scandal erupted when it came to light that American officials in the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) under the supervision of Obamas Department of Justice were allowing illegally purchased guns to walk into Mexico purportedly in the hope of tracking the guns to Mexican drug cartel leaders.(4) The harsh reality coming to light as revelations mount is that the administration was hoping to show an increase in crime perpetrated with those guns, so that the Justice Department in a duplicitous pincer strategy could use the data to push for gun control in America, while simultaneously pushing for the UN treaty at the international level.(4) Moreover, despite attempts by the UN to establish a link between an illegal, world gun market and crime in the U.S., Florida State University Professor of Criminology Gary Kleck has found no such link.

sentences.text: His new findings are in accord with previous research establishing that guns in the hands of law-abiding citizens reduce criminal activity and outweigh the illegal uses of firearms by criminals.(5-6) But what would this UN treaty entail? sentences.text: You may have seen a television ad about one of them: H.R. 308, introduced by gun-hating Carolyn McCarthy less than two weeks after the shooting, would ban so-called high-capacity magazines.

sentences.ctext: I think when you think about just common sense here, large capacity clips [sic] that can basically, in my opinion, be weapons of mass destruction, should not be available to the average citizen, McCarthy said in an NPR interview.

sentences.text: But in virtually every way possible, Arizona shooter Jared Loughner is testimony to a generation of failed gun control.

sentences.text: What if we applied that same groundless approach to other natural rights? Would we consider outlawing cameras or computers or strictly licensing them in defiance of free speech just because some people might use them to produce child pornography? Or do we hold individuals accountable for their actions and deprive them of life, liberty and property only after due process has been observed? The way we answer these questions is a good indicator of whether we support the rule of law or mob rule.

Gun confiscation, which is the end goal, leads to genocide.

sentences.ctext: January 28, 2014 Missouri legislators are battling it out over gun laws.

sentences.text: Last year, Governor Jay Nixon vetoed the Missouri Second Amendment legislation, HB436, which would have established the 'Second Amendment Preservation Act,' and would have criminalized federal agents enforcing federal gun laws.

sentences.text: The bill, in part, reads: "All federal acts, laws, executive orders, administrative orders, court orders, rules, and regulations, whether past, present, or future, which infringe on the people's right to keep and bear arms as guaranteed by the Second Amendment to the United States Constitution and Article I, Section 23 of the Missouri Constitution shall be invalid in this state, shall not be recognized by this state, shall be specifically rejected by this state, and shall be considered null and void and of no effect in this state."

sentences.text: Jan. 14 (Bloomberg) -- The atrocity committed last weekend in Tucson, Arizona, by alleged perpetrator Jared Loughner has predictably generated calls for new gun-control laws in the U.S.

sentences.ctext: Jan. 14 (Bloomberg) -- The atrocity committed last weekend in Tucson, Arizona, by alleged perpetrator Jared Loughner has predictably generated calls for new gun-control laws in the U.S.

sentences.text: Some want bans on the extended-capacity ammunition clips that allowed Loughner to fire more than 30 shots from his Glock semi-automatic pistol without reloading.

sentences.ctext: Some want bans on the extended-capacity ammunition clips that allowed Loughner to fire more than 30 shots from his Glock semi-automatic pistol without reloading.

sentences.text: Others want improved background screening to prevent mentally unstable individuals from purchasing guns.

sentences.ctext: Others want improved background screening to prevent mentally unstable individuals from purchasing guns.

sentences.text: Would these or other laws prevent incidents like the Arizona shooting? Probably not.

sentences.ctext: Would these or other laws prevent incidents like the Arizona shooting? Probably not.

sentences.text: And such laws, along with existing gun controls, not only harm responsible gun owners but may even increase violence.

sentences.ctext: And such laws, along with existing gun controls, not only harm responsible gun owners but may even increase violence.

sentences.text: Gun-control laws fall into two main categories.

sentences.ctext: Gun-control laws fall into two main categories.

sentences.text: Most in the U.S. are in and of themselves mild: They permit legal gun ownership for most people in most instances, while imposing modest costs on legitimate gun owners.

sentences.ctext: Most in the U.S. are in and of themselves mild: They permit legal gun ownership for most people in most instances, while imposing modest costs on legitimate gun owners.

sentences.text: Examples include criminal-background checks, waiting periods to purchase a gun, minimum purchase ages, and the like.

sentences.ctext: Examples include criminal-background checks, waiting periods to purchase a gun, minimum purchase ages, and the like.

sentences.text: These kinds of laws, however, are unlikely to deter someone like Loughner, who appears to have contemplated and planned his attack for a long time.

sentences.ctext: These kinds of laws, however, are unlikely to deter someone like Loughner, who appears to have contemplated and planned his attack for a long time.

sentences.text: The reason is simple: These laws are readily circumvented.
sentences.mtext: The=the=DT=0 reason=reason=NN=1 is=be=VBZ=2 simple=simple=JJ=3 :=:=:=4 These=these=DT=5 laws=law=NNS=6 are=be=VBP=7 readily=readily=RB=8 circumvented=circumvent=VBN=9 .=.=SENT=10
sentences.ctext: The reason is simple: These laws are readily circumvented.

sentences.text: Consider, for example, a ban on extended-capacity ammunition clips.

sentences.ctext: Consider, for example, a ban on extended-capacity ammunition clips.

sentences.text: If these had been unavailable, Loughner could still have carried out his attack with a 10-bullet clip, and he might have aimed more carefully knowing he had less ammunition.
sentences.mtext: If=if=IN=0 these=these=DT=1 had=have=VBD=2 been=be=VBN=3 unavailable=unavailable=JJ=4 ,=,=,=5 Loughner=Loughner=NP=6 could=could=MD=7 still=still=RB=8 have=have=VB=9 carried=carry=VBN=10 out=out=RP=11 his=his=PP$=12 attack=attack=NN=13 with=with=IN=14 a=a=DT=15 10-bullet=10-bullet=JJ=16 clip=clip=NN=17 ,=,=,=18 and=and=CC=19 he=he=PP=20 might=might=MD=21 have=have=VB=22 aimed=aim=VBN=23 more=more=RBR=24 carefully=carefully=RB=25 knowing=know=VBG=26 he=he=PP=27 had=have=VBD=28 less=less=JJR=29 ammunition=ammunition=NN=30 .=.=SENT=31
sentences.ctext: If these had been unavailable, Loughner could still have carried out his attack with a 10-bullet clip, and he might have aimed more carefully knowing he had less ammunition.

sentences.text: Loughner could have brought several guns, allowing him to continue firing without interruption.

sentences.ctext: Loughner could have brought several guns, allowing him to continue firing without interruption.

sentences.text: Loughner could have purchased extended-ammo clips that were sold before a ban took effect (especially since the prospect of bans stimulates sales in advance of implementation).

sentences.ctext: Loughner could have purchased extended-ammo clips that were sold before a ban took effect (especially since the prospect of bans stimulates sales in advance of implementation).

sentences.text: Or he could have bought a black- market clip, perhaps just by placing a classified advertisement.

sentences.ctext: Or he could have bought a black- market clip, perhaps just by placing a classified advertisement.

sentences.text: Similar difficulties confront the use of background checks designed to prevent the mentally unstable from buying guns.

sentences.ctext: Similar difficulties confront the use of background checks designed to prevent the mentally unstable from buying guns.

sentences.ctext: The U.S. already has such a system, but it wouldnt have stopped Loughner from buying a gun because it only applies when a court has decreed a person to be mentally unfit, which hadnt occurred in Loughners case.

sentences.text: Even a broader definition of mentally unfit probably wouldnt deter someone determined to commit violence.
sentences.mtext: Even=even=RB=0 a=a=DT=1 broader=broad=JJR=2 definition=definition=NN=3 of=of=IN=4 mentally=mentally=RB=5 unfit=unfit=JJ=6 probably=probably=RB=7 wouldnt=wouldnt=NN=8 deter=deter=VB=9 someone=someone=NN=10 determined=determine=VBN=11 to=to=TO=12 commit=commit=VB=13 violence=violence=NN=14 .=.=SENT=15
sentences.ctext: Even a broader definition of mentally unfit probably wouldnt deter someone determined to commit violence.

sentences.text: No matter how broad the definition, this approach does nothing to close the multiple avenues whereby anyone with sufficient cash can purchase a gun and ammunition.
sentences.mtext: No=no=DT=0 matter=matter=NN=1 how=how=WRB=2 broad=broad=JJ=3 the=the=DT=4 definition=definition=NN=5 ,=,=,=6 this=this=DT=7 approach=approach=NN=8 does=do=VBZ=9 nothing=nothing=NN=10 to=to=TO=11 close=close=VB=12 the=the=DT=13 multiple=multiple=JJ=14 avenues=avenue=NNS=15 whereby=whereby=WRB=16 anyone=anyone=NN=17 with=with=IN=18 sufficient=sufficient=JJ=19 cash=cash=NN=20 can=can=MD=21 purchase=purchase=VB=22 a=a=DT=23 gun=gun=NN=24 and=and=CC=25 ammunition=ammunition=NN=26 .=.=SENT=27
sentences.ctext: No matter how broad the definition, this approach does nothing to close the multiple avenues whereby anyone with sufficient cash can purchase a gun and ammunition.

sentences.text: Gun controls like those being proposed may, on occasion, prevent horrific events like the Tucson shooting or at least reduce their harm, but in all likelihood only rarely.
sentences.mtext: Gun=gun=NN=0 controls=control=NNS=1 like=like=IN=2 those=those=NNS=3 being=be=VBG=4 proposed=propose=VBN=5 may=may=MD=6 ,=,=,=7 on=on=IN=8 occasion=occasion=NN=9 ,=,=,=10 prevent=prevent=VB=11 horrific=horrific=JJ=12 events=event=NNS=13 like=like=IN=14 the=the=DT=15 Tucson=Tucson=NP=16 shooting=shooting=NN=17 or=or=CC=18 at=at=IN=19 least=least=JJS=20 reduce=reduce=VB=21 their=their=PP$=22 harm=harm=NN=23 ,=,=,=24 but=but=CC=25 in=in=IN=26 all=all=DT=27 likelihood=likelihood=NN=28 only=only=RB=29 rarely=rarely=RB=30 .=.=SENT=31
sentences.ctext: Gun controls like those being proposed may, on occasion, prevent horrific events like the Tucson shooting or at least reduce their harm, but in all likelihood only rarely.

sentences.text: Avoiding a few such incidents is surely better than avoiding none, so these controls would make sense if they had no negatives of their own.
sentences.mtext: Avoiding=avoid=VBG=0 a=a=DT=1 few=few=JJ=2 such=such=JJ=3 incidents=incident=NNS=4 is=be=VBZ=5 surely=surely=RB=6 better=well=RBR=7 than=than=IN=8 avoiding=avoid=VBG=9 none=none=NN=10 ,=,=,=11 so=so=RB=12 these=these=DT=13 controls=control=NNS=14 would=would=MD=15 make=make=VB=16 sense=sense=NN=17 if=if=IN=18 they=they=PP=19 had=have=VBD=20 no=no=DT=21 negatives=negative=NNS=22 of=of=IN=23 their=their=PP$=24 own=own=JJ=25 .=.=SENT=26
sentences.ctext: Avoiding a few such incidents is surely better than avoiding none, so these controls would make sense if they had no negatives of their own.

sentences.text: But gun controls, even mild ones, do have adverse consequences.
sentences.mtext: But=but=CC=0 gun=gun=NN=1 controls=control=NNS=2 ,=,=,=3 even=even=RB=4 mild=mild=JJ=5 ones=one=NNS=6 ,=,=,=7 do=do=VBP=8 have=have=VB=9 adverse=adverse=JJ=10 consequences=consequence=NNS=11 .=.=SENT=12
sentences.ctext: But gun controls, even mild ones, do have adverse consequences.

sentences.text: At a minimum, these laws impose costs on people who own and use guns without harming others, whether for hunting, collecting, target practice, self-defense, or just peace of mind.
sentences.mtext: At=at=IN=0 a=a=DT=1 minimum=minimum=NN=2 ,=,=,=3 these=these=DT=4 laws=law=NNS=5 impose=impose=VB=6 costs=cost=NNS=7 on=on=IN=8 people=people=NNS=9 who=who=WP=10 own=own=VBP=11 and=and=CC=12 use=use=VBP=13 guns=gun=NNS=14 without=without=IN=15 harming=harm=VBG=16 others=other=NNS=17 ,=,=,=18 whether=whether=IN=19 for=for=IN=20 hunting=hunting=NN=21 ,=,=,=22 collecting=collect=VBG=23 ,=,=,=24 target=target=NN=25 practice=practice=NN=26 ,=,=,=27 self-defense=self-defense=NN=28 ,=,=,=29 or=or=CC=30 just=just=RB=31 peace=peace=NN=32 of=of=IN=33 mind=mind=NN=34 .=.=SENT=35
sentences.ctext: At a minimum, these laws impose costs on people who own and use guns without harming others, whether for hunting, collecting, target practice, self-defense, or just peace of mind.

sentences.text: The inconvenience imposed by bans on extended-ammunition clips or waiting periods to buy a gun might seem trivial compared with the deaths and injuries that occur when someone like Loughner goes on a rampage.

sentences.ctext: The inconvenience imposed by bans on extended-ammunition clips or waiting periods to buy a gun might seem trivial compared with the deaths and injuries that occur when someone like Loughner goes on a rampage.

sentences.text: And if the only negative from these controls were such inconveniences, society might reasonably accept that cost, assuming these controls prevent some acts of violence.

sentences.ctext: And if the only negative from these controls were such inconveniences, society might reasonably accept that cost, assuming these controls prevent some acts of violence.

sentences.text: But mild controls dont always stay mild; more often, they evolve into strict limits on guns, bordering on outright prohibition.
sentences.mtext: But=but=CC=0 mild=mild=JJ=1 controls=control=NNS=2 dont=dont=VBP=3 always=always=RB=4 stay=stay=VB=5 mild=mild=JJ=6 ;=;=:=7 more=more=RBR=8 often=often=RB=9 ,=,=,=10 they=they=PP=11 evolve=evolve=VBP=12 into=into=IN=13 strict=strict=JJ=14 limits=limit=NNS=15 on=on=IN=16 guns=gun=NNS=17 ,=,=,=18 bordering=border=VBG=19 on=on=IN=20 outright=outright=JJ=21 prohibition=prohibition=NN=22 .=.=SENT=23
sentences.ctext: But mild controls dont always stay mild; more often, they evolve into strict limits on guns, bordering on outright prohibition.

sentences.text: And this isnt just slippery-slope speculation; a century ago most countries had few gun controls, yet today many have virtual bans on private ownership.

sentences.ctext: And this isnt just slippery-slope speculation; a century ago most countries had few gun controls, yet today many have virtual bans on private ownership.

sentences.text: Some of these countries (the U.K. and Japan) have low violence rates that might seem to justify strict controls, yet others experience substantial or extreme violence (Brazil and Mexico).

sentences.text: More broadly, comparisons between states and countries --as well as social-science research -- provide no consistent support for the claim that gun controls lower violence.

sentences.ctext: More broadly, comparisons between states and countries --as well as social-science research -- provide no consistent support for the claim that gun controls lower violence.

sentences.text: Strict controls and prohibition, moreover, dont eliminate guns any more than drug prohibition stops drug trafficking and use.

sentences.ctext: Strict controls and prohibition, moreover, dont eliminate guns any more than drug prohibition stops drug trafficking and use.

sentences.text: Prohibition might deter some potential gun owners, but mainly those who would own and use guns responsibly.

sentences.ctext: Prohibition might deter some potential gun owners, but mainly those who would own and use guns responsibly.

sentences.text: Folly of Prohibition Thus the classic slogan -- when guns are outlawed, only outlaws will have guns -- isnt only a word play; it is a fundamental insight into the folly of gun prohibition.

sentences.ctext: Timothy McVeighs 1995 Oklahoma City bombing, which killed 168 people, illustrates perfectly that a determined lunatic has multiple ways to inflict harm.

sentences.ctext: Beyond being ineffective, gun prohibition might even increase violence by creating a large black market in guns.

sentences.text: So if gun laws follow the path of drug laws, we can expect more violence under gun prohibition than in a society with limited or no controls.
